SENT.plain: Space-occupying middle cerebral artery infarction represents about 10 to 15% of supratentorial ischemic strokes
This syndrome carries a high rate of mortality and requires aggressive surgical decompression
The authors present 6 patients with signs of trans-tentorial herniation operated on between February 2001 and August 2003
Neurological preoperative status was evaluated with Glasgow coma scale score and postoperatively with Barthel index
Three patients had excellent recovery (Barthel Index up to 70), one remained dependant and two died
Decompressive surgery, when done early, should improve mortality rate and even functional outcome
Optimal selection of patients, with the help of Diffusion-Weighted imaging, could vouch good results
